description: INSTALLATION OF KITCHEN EXTRACT DUCTING SYSTEM AND 4NO. EXTERNAL WEATHER LOUVRES
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 
Site Location Plan, DW-004 Rev 01, DW-005 Rev 01 and DW-006 Rev 01.

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The recommendations and criteria to control the noise impact on the surrounding noise sensitive properties, from the commercial mechanical plant, as specified in the Syntegra Consulting Ltd, Plant Noise Assessment, dated March 2023, shall be implemented and maintained as a minimum standard. A post implementation acoustic report shall be submitted to the LPA to confirm compliance. 
Reason:  To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity.

Condition : 5 - The scheme to manage the control of odour from cooking shall be designed and installed to meet the technical requirements of the document 'Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems' as published by EMAQ dated 2018 to meet the criteria for 'very high level odour control'. The implemented scheme shall be fully operated, maintained and serviced in accordance with the manufacturers' instructions or requirements, whilst the premises is in production.
Reason:  To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity.

Condition : 6 - Drainage serving the commercial kitchen part of the premises shall be fitted with an adequate grease separator.
Reason:  To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
